data.title: Historical Events on July 12
data.meta_description: Historical events for the 12th of July. See what famous, interesting and notable events happened throughout history on July 12.
data.text:
St Felix IV begins his reign as Catholic Pope

King Aethelstan is the first southern English king to gain control of much of the north of Britain when various local kings accept his overlordship at Eamont, Cumbria

Crusaders capture Syria's harbor city of Tripoli

Crusaders Take Acre

Third Crusade: City of Acre surrenders to English King Richard I the Lionheart and the Crusaders after a siege of nearly two years

Alfonso V

King Alfonso V of Aragon becomes King of Naples

Battle of Albancay

Battle of Albancay: Diego de Almagro defeated by army led by Alonso de Alvarado on behalf of Francisco Pizarro

French troops under Maarten van Rossem occupy Flanders

Kett's uprising occupies Norwich, England

"Trinity Church" (now Saint Basil's Cathedral) is consecrated in Moscow, Russia, built to commemorate defeat of the Mongols at battle of Kazan

1561 Diego de Lando, Bishop of Yucatan, burns on a large pyre Maya religious objects and most of the last surviving books of bark outside the Franciscan convent of Man√≠

Ostrog Bible, the first printed Bible in a Slavic language, is published

Invasion of √éle de R√©

English invasion fleet under George Villiers lands on the √éle de R√©, forced to withdraw after 3 months of combat and losing 4,000 of 7,000 troops

New Amsterdam's governor buys Gull Island from Indians for cargo, renames it Oyster Island, later known as Ellis Island

Habeas Corpus Ratified

Britain's King Charles II ratifies Habeas Corpus Act allowing prisoners' right to a court review of the justification for their imprisonment

Antonio Pignatelli elected as Pope Innocentius XII

Battle of Aughrim

Battle of Aughrim (Aghrim) Ireland, William III beats James II

Gregory Conquers Julius Caesar

Gelderland accepts Gregorian calendar; yesterday is June 30, 1700

Stanislaw Leszcynski becomes king of part of Poland

Ottoman army officer Al-·∏§usayn ibn  øAlƒ´ proclaims himself Bey of Tunis, founding the Husainid Dynasty (dynasty rules till 1957)

Lorenzo Corsini chosen as Pope Clemens XII

Cook Returns from First Voyage

HMS Endeavour captained by James Cook, with Joseph Banks aboard, returns from its first voyage to the Pacific after two years

Citizens of Carlisle, Pennsylvania, pass a symbolic declaration of independence

1774 Cossack leader Emilian Pugachevs army occupies Kazan

Captain James Cook departs Plymouth, England helming HMS Resolution, beginning his 3rd and final trip to the Pacific

1st manned flight in Netherlands: Frenchman Jean-Pierre Blanchard lifts off in his gas balloon from Noordeinde Palace in The Hauge

French Revolution: The Civil Constitution of the Clergy is adopted, putting the Catholic Church in France under the control of the state

Second Battle of Algeciras: British fleet beats French and Spanish (six days after losing the 1st Battle of Algeciras)

The Death of Alexander Hamilton

Former United States Secretary of the Treasury Alexander Hamilton dies after being shot in a pistol duel the previous day by Vice President Aaron Burr

US forces led by General Hull invade Canada (War of 1812)

1st flower show held in Dannybrook, County Cork, Ireland

1817 Karl Drais von Sauerbronn demonstrates bicycle course

Mormons Support Polygamy

Mormon leader Joseph Smith says God allows polygamy

Dutch 2nd Chamber accepts establishment of Provincial States

Paper bag manufacturing machine patents by William Goodale, Massachusetts

Wild Bill Hickok

"Wild Bill" Hickok legend is born as he reputedly shoots and kills David McCanles in Rock Creek, Nebraska Territory; Hickok later acquitted of murder as court finds he acted in self defense.

Federal troops occupy Helena, Arkansas

1862 US Congress authorizes Medal of Honor

British forces invade the Waikato In New Zealand, home of the MƒÅori King Movement, beginning a new phase of the New Zealand Wars between the colonial government and allied MƒÅori tribes on one side and MƒÅori on the other [1]

Ontario Agricultural College founded

Fever epidemic in New Orleans begin, it will kill 4,500

Agricultural and industrial tariffs are introduced in Germany

1st ocean pier in US completed, Washington, D.C.

Jean-Baptiste Marchand hoists French flag in Fashoda, Sudan

114¬∞F (46¬∞C), Basin, Wyoming (state record)

Young Wins 300

Cy Young wins his 300th baseball game

1901 In Germany a group of 104 aristocrats present a deceleration against dueling, though the tradition will go on

1901 Striking Canadian salmon fishermen on the Pacific coast, resentful of the non-union Japanese who continue to fish, maroon and imprison 47

Arthur Balfour Prime Minister

Arthur Balfour succeeds Lord Salisbury, who retired as British Prime Minister on 11 July

The British and Japanese renew their alliance (of January 1902) for 10 years and agree to provide mutual support if attacked by other power

Dreyfus Found Inncoent

The Dreyfus Affair: Alfred Dreyfus is found innocent of treason in France

16th Amendment was passed by congress (power to tax incomes)

1st foreign feature film exhibited in US - "Queen Elizabeth" in NYC

150,000 Ulstermen gather and resolve to resist Irish Home Rule by force of arms; since the British Liberals have promised the Irish nationalists Home Rule, civil war appears imminent

3rd and 4th of 4 fatal Jersey Shore shark attacks occurs at Matawan Creek when epileptic Lester Stilwell (11) is dragged into a creek and Watson Fisher (24), believing Silwell had a seizure, is bitten while retrieving the body and subsequently bleeds to death

1916 Joseph Dunn (14) is attacked by a shark, suffering non-fatal wounds in New Jersey, the final episode in a spate of shark attacks along the Jersey coast where 4 people died over 12 days

The Bisbee Deportation occurs as vigilantes kidnap and deport nearly 1,300 striking miners and others from Bisbee, Arizona

Japanese battleship explodes in Bay of Tokayama, 500 killed

Lithuania and USSR sign peace treaty, Lithuania becomes independent republic

Cleveland Indians (9) & New York Yankees (7) combine for an AL record 16 doubles

Guomindangleger draws against warlord Wu Peifu

Nurmi World Record

Paavo Nurmi walks world record 4x1500m (16:26.2)

Ruth Half Way to Record

Yankees slugger Babe Ruth, half way to his MLB record of 60 home runs, smacks #30 off Joe Shautes in 9th inning in New York's 7-0 win over Cleveland Indians at Dunn Field in Cleveland

1st televised tennis match

Bradman Out for 334

Australian cricket master batsman Don Bradman is out for 334 in drawn 3rd Test vs England at Headingley, Leeds; innings 383 minutes, 46 x 4's

45,715 fans in 35,000 seat Sportsman Park St Louis, help cause many ground ruled doubles, 11 in 1st game & 21 in 2nd game for 32

Hedley Verity establishes a first-class cricket record by taking all ten wickets for only ten runs against Nottinghamshire on a pitch affected by a storm

Congress passes 1st minimum wage law (33 cents per hour)

US Disciplinary Barracks on Alcatraz Island abandoned

1934 Willy de Supervise swims world record 400m (5:16.0)

Belgium recognizes Soviet Union

-13) Tupolev ANT-25 non-stop flight Moscow to San Jacinto, California

Frederick McKinley Jones receives a patent for an air conditioning unit for trucks, helping to change long-haul carriage of food and blood

8th day of Battle of Kursk, USSR: Operation Kutuzov (Soviet counter-offensive begins

1943 Battle of Kolombangara (Second Battle of Gulf of Kula)

1943 National Committee Freies Deutschland forms

Pope Receives German Ambassador

Pope Pius XII receives German ambassador baron von Weizsacker

1943 Soviet offensive at Orel

1943 World War II: Battle of Prokhorovka - Russia defeats German forces in one of the largest ever tank battles

Theresienstadt Family camp disbands, with 4,000 people gased

US Recognizes De Gaulle

US government recognizes authority of French General Charles de Gaulle

Chicago Cubs beat Boston, 6-1 to halt Braves outfielder Tommy Holmes' modern-day record NL hitting streak at 37 games

Rape of Lucretia

Benjamin Britten's "Rape of Lucretia" premieres at Glyndebourne Opera Festival

1946 Vance Dinges hits only Phillie pinch hit inside-the-park HR

1st jets to fly across Atlantic (6 RAF de Havilland Vampires)

Baseball owners agree to erect warning paths before each fence

1949 Dutch KLM Constellation crashes near Bombay, 45 die

1949 LA Rams sign Norm Van Brocklin

Hague Council of Annulment convicts German war criminals W Lages, FH Van de Funten and F Fischer to death

Mob tries to keep black family from moving into all-white Cicero, Illinois

Sports History

NY Yankees pitcher Allie Reynolds throws no-hitter in Cleveland against the Indians, his former team, in a 1-0 win

KTVB TV channel 7 in Boise, ID (NBC/ABC) begins broadcasting

ANC President Albert Luthuli banned by South African Minister of Justice from attending public gatherings and confined to the magisterial district of Lower Tugela, Natal

1954 Major League Baseball Players Association founded

Event of Interest

President Eisenhower put forward a plan for an interstate highway system

Christian Democratic Party forms in Argentina

1st President to fly in helicopter-Dwight Eisenhower

1957 US Surgeon General Leroy Burney connects smoking with lung cancer

US performs atmospheric nuclear test at Bikini Island

NBC uses cameras to show catchers signals during Yankee-Red Sox game

Orlyonok, the main Young Pioneer camp of the Russian SFSR, is founded.

1960 USSR's Sputnik 5 launched with 2 dogs

1960 XEWT TV channel 12 in Tijuana-San Diego, CA (IND) begins broadcasting

1st time 2 manned crafts in space (USSR)

1962 Rolling Stones 1st performance (Marquee Club, London)

10.51" (26.70 cm) of rainfall in Sandusky,Ohio (state record, until broken in 1995)

1966 Start of 3 day race riot in Chicago, looting brings out National Guardsmen

1966 US Treasury announces it will buy mutilated silver coins at silver bullion price at Philadelphia and Denver mints

Greek regime deprives 480 Greeks of their citizenship

1967 Race riot in Newark, New Jersey, 26 killed, 1,500 injured & over 1,000 arrested

Couve de Murville forms government in France

1968 USSR performs nuclear test at the Semipalatinsk Test Site in northeast Kazakhstan

As the 'marching season' reaches its height there is serious rioting in Derry, Belfast and Dungiven; many families in Belfast are forced to move from their homes

Tanzania signs contract with China for building Tanzam-railway

Event of Interest

Thor Heyerdahl crosses the Atlantic ocean on the raft Ra II, arrives in Barbados from Morocco after 57 days

Juan Corona, indicted for 25 murders

Event of Interest

Democrats nominate George McGovern for US president in Miami, Florida

1972 Twelve years after the banning of the ANC and Pan Africanist Congress, a new political movement, the Black People Convention is formed after a three day long conference in Pietermaritzburg, South Africa

A fire destroys the entire 6th floor of the National Personnel Records Center of the United States

John Ehrlichman convicted of violating Daniel Ellsberg's rights

England cricket wicketkeeper Bob Taylor catches 7 in an innings for Derbyshire v Yorkshire at Queen's Park, Chesterfield

1975 Sao Tom√© e Pr√≠ncipe gains independence from Portugal (National Day)

1st "Family Feud" game show debuts on ABC hosted by Richard Dawson

1976 Ian Dury & Kilburns disband

John Edrich scores his 100th 100, Surrey v Derbyshire at The Oval

US performs nuclear test at Nevada Test Site

Down With Disco!

"Disco Demolition Night" at Comiskey Park: fans go wild destroying disco records and cause the White Sox to forfeit second game of a doubleheader to the Detroit Tigers

1979 Ian Paice joins Whitesnake

1979 Kiribati (formerly Gilbert Islands) declares independence from the United Kingdom

Britain announces it is returning 593 Argentine POWs

1982 FEMA promises survivors of a nuclear war will get their mail

Chad government troops reconquer Ab√©ch√©

A car bomb set off by the military wing of the ANC, explodes in Durban South Africa killing 5 and injuring 27 people

Appointment of Interest

Geraldine Ferraro becomes the 1st US female major-party vice-presidential candidate, after Walter Mondale selects her as his Democratic Party running mate

Event of Interest

Doctors discover a cancerous growth in President Ronald Reagan's colon

1985 STS 51-F launch scrubbed at T -3s because of main engine shutdown

Steven McDonald, New York City Police Department patrolman, is shot and paralyzed by Shavod Jones

1st time in 20 years a delegation from USSR lands in Israel

1987 50 white South Africans meets ANCers in Dakar

1987 Phillies Kent Tekulve pitches his 900th game in relief

Margo Adams alleges Red Sox Wade Bogg's had an affair with her

1988 USSR launches Phobos II for Martian orbit

Sports History

NY Yankee pitching great Ron Guidry retires (170-91 .651, 3.29 ERA)

Event of Interest

Boris Yeltsin quits the Soviet Communist Party

1990 Chicago White Sox Melido Perez no-hits Yankees 8-0 in a rain shortened 6 inning game at Yankee Stadium (7th no-hitter of 1990)

1990 In Soweto, South Africa, Shanty town women strip to the waist and confront bulldozers sent by authorities to demolish their homes

Music Concert

Axl Rose arrested on riot charges in St Louis stemming from a concert on Jul 2

7.8 earthquake hits Hokkaido Japan, 160 killed

Sunset Boulevard

Andrew Lloyd Webber's musical "Sunset Boulevard", based on Billy Wilder's 1950 film, starring Patti Lupone and Daniel Benzali, opens at the Adelphi Theatre, London

1993 Talk radio host Don Imus begins broadcasting to Boston on WEEI (590 AM)

Nomination hearings for Steven Breyer for supreme court justice begins

Enrique Iglesias

Enrique Iglesias releases his first album, "Enrique Iglesias"

Sports History

Kirby Puckett, MLB centerfielder, retires after 12 seasons from Minnesota Twins, due to loss of vision in one eye

Contract of Interest

Michael Jordan signs a NBA contract with the Chicago Bulls, for 1 year for $30.1 million

1996 Start of 1st "Super 8's" tournament in Kuala Lumpur

Cubs play in their 5,000th consecutive game without being no-hit

1997 Pittsburgh Pirates duo Francisco Cordova & Ricardo Rincon no-hit Houston Astros, 3-0 in 10 innings at Three Rivers Stadium

FIFA World Cup

FIFA World Cup Final, Stade de France, Saint-Denis: Zinedine Zidane scores twice as France wins first World Cup beating Brazil, 3-0

Event of Interest

South African President Nelson Mandela accompanies Queen Elizabeth II on a coach drive through the streets of London

Devdas

Hindi film "Devdas" premieres directed by Sanjay Leela Bhansali and starring Shah Rukh Khan, Aishwarya Rai and Madhuri Dixit (Best Film Filmfare Awards)

Hezbollah initiates Operation True Promise.

Canadian harness racer John Campbell wins his 10,000th race as a driver by guiding 'Share the Delight' to victory in the 6th race at Meadowlands Racetrack

200 people are killed by the Syrian army in Tremseh

2012 90-155 people are killed after an oil tanker crashes and explodes in Okogbe, Rivers State, Nigeria

8 people are killed after a commuter train derails in Paris

United Nations Speech

Malala Yousafzai addresses the United Nations and calls for worldwide access to education

Event of Interest

Bernie Sanders endorses fellow Democratic Presidential candidate Hillary Clinton in a speech in New Hampshire

World's largest iceberg (later christened A68) breaks away from Larsen C Ice Shelf in Antarctica, about 6,000 sq km in length

2018 Chemical plant explosion in Jiangan County, Sichuan Province, China, kills at least 19

2018 Republic of Ireland will be the first country to sell off its investments in fossil fuel companies after passing legislation in parliament

Film & TV History

Sandra Oh is the first woman of Asian descent to be nominated for an Emmy Award in a leading role for "Killing Eve"

2018 World's longest fingernails cut off; Indian man Shridhar Chillal's left hand nails measured combined total 909.6 cm (358.1 inches) after growing for 66 years

At least 92 people die in a fire in a COVID-19 hospital ward in Iraqi city of Nasiriya

Netflix's South Korean drama "Squid Game" is the first non-English series to be nominated for an Emmy for Outstanding Drama [1]

NATO summit ends in Vilnius, Lithuania, with Turkey agreeing to Sweden's membership and Ukraine membership ‚Äúwhen allies agree and conditions are met‚Äù [1]
